intro: Torilis arvensis subsp. arvensis, commonly known as field hedge parsley, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with slender stems and opposite, pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom from June to August. Its fruits are dry, two-lobed schizocarps, each containing a single seed. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
